body_content.explanation: to prepare to fight again, or make armed forces ready to fight again, after a period when there was no fighting:
examples: The leader of the rebels threatened to remobilize if the international troops withdrew.
The army remobilized its reserve troops in anticipation of trouble.

body_content.explanation: to organize or prepare something, such as a group of people, for a purpose again after a period of not being active:
examples: The reformers in the party remobilized and forced the leader to resign.
She has been able to remobilize voters who stayed at home in the last election.
